slokas: धृतराष्ट्र उवाचधर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सव: ।मामका: पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled in the holy land of Kurukshetra and desiring to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचदृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा ।आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्  ॥  २ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: Beholding the Pandava army arrayed in battle formation, King Duryodhana then approached his teacher and spoke these words.

slokas: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् ।व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Behold, O teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, your wise disciple.

slokas: अत्र श‍ूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि ।युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Here are the brave warriors like Bhima and Arjuna fighting fiercely in battle. Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada are also mighty warriors.

slokas: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् ।पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, Kashiraja, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, Shaibya are all valiant warriors.

slokas: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् ।सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Yudhamanyu, Vikranta, Uttamauja, the valiant; Saubhadra, the son of Draupadi; all of them are mighty warriors.

slokas: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम ।नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थ तान्ब्रवीमि ते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: O best of the Brahmanas, know those who are our leaders in the army. I shall now tell you of them for your information.

slokas: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिंजयः ।अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: You are Bhishma, Karna, Krpa, victorious in battle; Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also Saumadatti.

slokas: अन्ये च बहवः श‍ूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः ।नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Others too, many of them, valiant warriors, sacrificing their lives for my sake, armed with various weapons, all skilled in battle.

slokas: अपर्याप्त‍ं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् ।पर्याप्त‍ं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Our strength, protected by Bhishma, is inadequate. But their strength, protected by Bhima, is adequate.

slokas: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागवमस्थिताः ।भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: May all of you be stationed according to your respective positions on all sides of Bhishma only.

slokas: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः ।सिंहनादं विनद्योच्च‍ैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: His grandfather Kuru, filled with joy and pride, roared like a lion and blew his conch loudly, displaying his prowess.

slokas: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः ।सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: Then, conches, drums, and horns, blaring forth simultaneously, were sounded; and the noise was tumultuous.

slokas: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ ।माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Then, in the great conchshell, white horses yoked, Krishna and Arjuna stationed, blew their divine conches.

slokas: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः ।पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: The conch named Panchajanya, the bow called Hrishikesha, the sword named Devadatta, and the mace called Dhananjaya.

slokas: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ।नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: The king Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, along with Nakula and Sahadeva, possessed the inexhaustible wealth of jewels and flowers.

slokas: काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: ।धृष्टद्युम्न‍ो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्‍चापराजित: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Kashya, the Supreme among the Vasus, Shikhandi, the great charioteer, Dhristadyumna, Virata, and the unconquered Satyaki.

slokas: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते ।सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक्पृथक् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Draupadi, the daughter of Drupada, and all the sons of Prithivi, and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra, all blew their respective conch shells.

slokas: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् ।नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: That sound shattered the hearts of the Dhartarashtras, and also the sky and the earth, resounding tumultuously.

slokas: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान्कपिध्वजः ।प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः ।हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Then, seeing the Kauravas arrayed in battle order, Arjuna, the son of Pandu, raising his bow, spoke these words to Krishna, O King.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचसेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ।यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्‍धुकामानवस्थितान् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O infallible one, please place my chariot between the two armies so that I may see those who stand here, desiring to fight.

slokas: कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्‍रणसमुद्यमे ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: With what effort should one engage in this battle?

slokas: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः ।धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: I see those who have assembled here, desiring to fight in the battle, out of love for the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra.

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत ।सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: O Bharata, having thus been addressed by Gudakesha, Hrishikesha placed the excellent chariot in the midst of the two armies.

slokas: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम्  ।उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरुनिति ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Bhishma and Drona, along with all the other warriors, said: "O Partha, behold these assembled Kurus."

slokas: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान्।आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा।श्वश‍ुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: There Arjuna could see, stationed in both armies, fathers and grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, friends, and also fathers-in-law and friends in both armies.

slokas: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्  ।कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: Seeing all his relatives present there, Arjuna, the son of Kunti, overwhelmed by great compassion and sorrowfully spoke these words.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचदृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम्  ।सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिश‍ुष्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O Krishna, seeing my own kinsmen standing arrayed, eager for battle, my limbs fail and my mouth is parched.

slokas: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते ।गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्च‍ैव परिदह्यते ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: Trembling arises in my body, and my hair stands on end. The Gandiva bow slips from my hand, and my skin is burning all over.

slokas: न च शक्न‍ोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः ।निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: I am unable to stand still; my mind is unsteady. I see adverse omens, O Keshava.

slokas: न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ।न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: I do not see any good in killing my own kinsmen in battle, nor do I desire victory, O Krishna, nor pleasures.

slokas: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ।येषामर्थे काङ्‍‍क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च ॥ ३२  ॥
slokas_translated: What is the use of a kingdom, Govinda, or pleasures, or even life itself, to us, for whose sake the kingdom, pleasures, and joys are desired?

slokas: त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ।आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः ॥ ३3॥
slokas_translated: Those who are situated in the battlefield, having renounced their lives and wealth, include teachers, fathers, sons, and also grandfathers.

slokas: मातुलाः श्वश‍ुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ।एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्न‍तोऽपि मधुसूदन ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: Maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, sons, grandsons, as well as other relatives, I do not wish to kill, even if they kill me, O Madhusudana.

slokas: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते ।निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्ज‍नार्दन ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Even by killing all these aggressors, our hearts will be satisfied, O Krishna, what joy will there be for us?

slokas: पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः ।तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्सबान्धवान् ।स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: We should not kill our relatives, the sons of Dhritarashtra, who are our family members, even if they are filled with greed.

slokas: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ॥ ३७
slokas_translated: Even though these people, whose minds are overpowered by greed, do not see the fault in the destruction of families and the sin in betraying friends.

slokas: ॥कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मन्निवर्तितुम् ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भ‍िर्जनार्दन ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: How can we not know how to dispel our sin, O Janardana, when we see the crime of destroying the family?

slokas: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः ।धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: When the family declines, the eternal family duties perish. With the destruction of righteousness, unrighteousness becomes prevalent in the entire family.

slokas: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः ।स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: When unrighteousness prevails, O Krishna, the women of the family become corrupt; and from the corruption of women, O descendant of Vrishni, arises unwanted progeny.

slokas: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्न‍ानां कुलस्य च ।पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who destroy the family, and are impure, fall into hell. The ancestors of such people are deprived of offerings of rice and water.

slokas: दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्न‍ानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः ।उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: By these faults of those who destroy the family, producing confusion in caste, the eternal duties of caste and family are destroyed.

slokas: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन ।नरके नियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुश‍ुश्रुम ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_translated: For those who are born with noble qualities, O Janardana, dwelling in hell is not destined.

slokas: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् ।यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas_translated: Oh, how terrible it is that we are determined to commit a great sin by killing our own kinsmen out of greed for the pleasures of a kingdom.

slokas: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः ।धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas_translated: If they do not retaliate against me with weapons in battle, the sons of Dhritarashtra, then my safety will be assured.

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् ।विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्न‍मानसः ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, Arjuna, in the midst of the battlefield, sat down on the seat of his chariot, casting aside bow and arrows, his mind overwhelmed with sorrow.
